result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/Huber; Concurrent with each count and with 15CM1473

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson in court with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. COURT ORDERS: JOC AMENDED 97 DAYS CREDIT, NO RESTITUTION

Defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson in court in custody with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily to Count 1; Deft pleads Guilty to Count 2; Court accepts pleas and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 9 months RCJail, each count Concurrent and concurrent with 15CM1473; DOC collect costs with 15CF712 & 15CF2046. Restitution to be determined at Hearing.  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson in court in custody with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson in court in custody with attorney Adam Thomas Witt.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Freier withdraws due to conflict; Atty Witt is now Atty of Record.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson in court in custody with attorney Joseph M. Freier.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily, rights given.  Court binds Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to defendant, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson in court in custody with attorney Joseph M. Freier.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brandii Danyeil Johnson in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Continued Adjourned Initial Appearance 10-09-2015 at 3pm c/c Meyer, JAR
